definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: She offers up silly advice and is clueless about the latest fashion rage.
sentences.chinese: 她一無所知，老出餿主意，對流行時尚一竅不通。

sentences.english: Whose hare-brained idea was it to padlock the fire exits?
sentences.chinese: 安全門上鎖是誰的餿主意？

sentences.english: We went the long way, thanks to your rotten idea.
sentences.chinese: 由於你的餿主意，我們跑了不少冤枉路。

sentences.english: Let's look at some of the most troubling ideas in detail.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們詳細看一下其中一些最愚蠢的餿主意。

sentences.english: But the computer company  stock he told me to buy was a lemon.
sentences.chinese: 可是這次他讓我買那個電腦公司的股票卻是個餿主意。

sentences.english: It’s not a bad idea to put motion detectors up there too.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏裝一個運動監測器肯定不會是一個餿主意。

definition: to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
to whisper to one another's ear
